WRITING.TEXT: I don't sorry, Only started watercolour this week after a long 10 year break!
How do you choose a different Direct x, there is no option for me in the settings?

Well I plugged them straight into the reciever yesterday and loaded up Spotify and first impressions were not very good. Then I realised I had the free version of spotify which has a lower quality than premium?
But I did some ps4 gaming, watched a movie and I can't fault them. Very comfortable and amazing sound quality. This is my first decent pair of headphones so I'm impressed. I paid $260 AUD for mine but they are worth every penny.
Cool thanks for the info. Got my eye on a Sennheiser cable
Oh ok, but I can plug this splitter into the controller and then my mic into the mic jack?

I can tell you how it sounds tomorrow :) Still waiting for the post. The reason I would to run the 598's through my receiver is, I'd imagine the quality is much better than running through the controller? I don't know. I'm a noob when it comes to audio setups.
I'm confused about this cable. If I only want to plug the mic into the controller, why would I need this splitter?

WRITING.TITLE: Can I use a modmic plugged into my controller with some Sennheisers plugged into my AV Receiver?
WRITING.TEXT: Ok, I've just ordered some Sennheiser 598's. I will be plugging these into my Yamaha AV Receiver for games music and movies. If I want to be able to chat in game can I just use something like a modmic plugged straight into the controller?
Thanks for the suggestion. That mic is $80 here in Australia! Might be a bit out of my budget.
I like the compactness of that FiiO, Ive heard the Astro is popular too. Cheers

WRITING.TITLE: Headphones for PS4, do I need an amp?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm thinking of getting either Sennheiser HD558 or the 598. Would I need an amp along with this or will plugging straight into the controller sound decent? If an amp is preferable, any suggestions? Clip on mic suggestions with this setup would be welcomed as well. Cheers!
Thanks for this, added to my list!
Seems great, but wont be buying until theres support for more devices, Roku, Apple TV, etc. Not many people watch netflix on their PC/Mac
